title: fix(rig-810): prompting OpenAI reponses with message history fails
body:
Fixes #577 
Fixes RIG-810

Tested with `debate.rs` to ensure it actually does work.

title: feat(rig-812): yield final response with total usage metrics from streaming completion response in stream impl
body:
fixes #580 
fixes RIG-812

The `converse_output.rs` file is unfortunately necessary, due to absolutely none of the AWS SDK types implementing Serialize or Deserialize. It's basically just reimplementing a tonne of the types from the Bedrock Runtime crate except now they implement Deserialize and Serialize.

title: feat: add `.extended_details` to `PromptRequest`
body:
Fixes #433

Leverages typestate back on `PromptRequest` since the `.send` needs to return a struct instead of a string. otherwise, this allows you to easily encapsulate aggregated token usage with multi-turn usage.

## Testing
`cargo run --example multi_turn_agent_extended`

title: feat(rig-799): add support for official rust sdk for mcp
body:
Fixes #551
Fixes RIG-799

Supercedes #422 due to internal business requirements and therefore some urgency may be required for keeping on top of CI. Credits to @byeblack for the initial submitted code.

The current MCP items have been put into a new `mcp` module within the tools file and the new items from `rmcp` have been added into an `rmcp` module. This prevents module conflicts and should allow for an easy transition between the two. The release after next, we should put a deprecation warning on the original `mcp` module to let people know we will be deprecating it.

title: feat(rig-801): DynClientBuilder::from_values
body:
Fixes #554

Implementation is pretty scuffed, not sure this is 100% the final design. Probably still a couple of final details left to iron out here.

title: fix(rig-820): ensure call ID is properly propagated
body:
Fixes #600 
Fixes RIG-820

We weren't setting the call ID in the streaming function, so inevitably nothing was passed in which caused OpenAI to freak out.

edit: There were some additional changes that were required to be made, so the PR title will be amended to reflect this.

2. updated all the `insert_document` methods from db to use the new trait

title: feat(rig-823): impl size hint for OneOrMany types
body:
Fixes #605 
Fixes RIG-823

cc @Sytten - I believe this seems to work? I pretty much just copy and pasted your implementation in and it seems to be fine (and have added tests to prove it). Theoretically speaking there should always be at least one item, but seeing as I would much rather not voluntarily panic unless there is a need to do so, I've just returned the `(0, Some(0))` instead.

new stream api:

title: feat(rig-754): support custom client configurations
body:
Fixes #467 
Fixes RIG-754

Additionally adds an upgrade to the Debug implementation for every client such that the API key will never be exposed when using Debug. This is a highly important implementation detail as the user should not need to work around this if/when implementing observability systems that additionally cover Rig.

title: feat: add ScyllaDB vector store implementation
body:
## Summary
Adds a new ScyllaDB vector store implementation to the Rig ecosystem.

Fixes #531

## Implementation Details
- New `rig-scylladb` crate following existing vector store patterns
- Application-level cosine similarity search (similar to SQLite/SurrealDB implementations)
- `VectorStoreIndex` trait implementation

title: fix: dynamically pull rag text from chat history
body:
Fixes #420 and supersedes #421 .

The main fix is via not gathering the raggable text from only the current prompt but also going up from latest to oldest methods.

Basically, if the prompt has no raggable text, traverse backwards up chat history until you find some.

title: fix: o-series models + constants
body:
Added new constants and detection of `o` series models for using proper roles.
TODO: better detection of `o` series models.

Fixes #419

title: feat(rig-764): gitignore .envrc
body:
`.envrc` is used by [direnv](https://direnv.net/), a program you can use to automatically set env vars upon entering a directory rather than having to spend time remembering what they are.

I'm currently pretty careful about not accidentally committing it, but needless to say we should probably gitignore it for any future contributors.

title: feat: AWS Bedrock provider
body:
Added new model provider as a separate crate because it depends on AWS SDK. 
Relates to [issue](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/issues/317)

### Important:
Access to Amazon Bedrock foundation models **isn't granted by default.** You can request access, or modify access, to foundation models only by using the Amazon Bedrock console.

This is what you would get if you ran all example programs:

[agent_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949238/agent_with_bedrock.txt)
[document_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949239/document_with_bedrock.txt)
[embedding_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949240/embedding_with_bedrock.txt)
[extractor_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949241/extractor_with_bedrock.txt)
[image_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949242/image_with_bedrock.txt)
[rag_with_bedrock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18949243/rag_with_bedrock.txt)

title: fix: Resolved the issue of failed PDF loading.
body:
This morning, when writing an [article](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/Z2lX0gopCtgQpjFaKQBnwQ), I found that the loading of some PDF files of papers failed. 

After investigation, the cause of the failure was: 

> Error reading PDF content: IO error: ToUnicode CMap error: Could not parse ToUnicodeCMap: Error

I tried to upgrade `lopdf` from version `0.34.0` to `0.35.0`, and the problem was successfully resolved. 

You can reproduce this issue by running the example code in `pdf_agent.rs`. 

After upgrading the version, the problem can be resolved.

title: feat: postgres vector store
body:
Resolves #5 based on PR #157

@milancermak mentioned not having time to finish his PR so I created this one based on his implementation.

Current code has just the library code but I added an integration test based on rig-qdrant module, it starts a Docker container with Postgres + PgVector and it simulate calls to OpenAI using a mocked API.

Difference from previous PR:
- removed static lifetime
- the documents are stored as json in the database so you can use any type that implements `Serializable`, `Deserializable`
- support for more than one embedding per document (this also is not supported in rig-qdrant that only takes first vector), in the case more than one result hit the same document only nearest one is returned.
- use sqlx instead of tokio-postgres
- creation of database is outside the code and I provide example of setup in integration test (using sqlx migrations)
- you can use any distance filter supported by PgVector (is not hardcoded to cosine)
- Created example that can be launch using `make run` (from rig-postgres folder), load environmental variables from `.env` file and handles documents with more than one embedding. It also runs migrations automatically on the database to make sure Postgres tables are ready for the test.

Pending:
- add documentation

title: feat: groq integration
body:
Fixes #145 

An attempt was made to use the `openai` provider module but it looks like each provider module's `CompletionModel` struct is dependent on each provider's client module rather than a trait, which makes refactoring slightly more complicated.

title: feat: Add support for Sqlite vector store
body:
# New vector store: Sqlite

## Description

Sqlite using [sqlite-vec](https://github.com/asg017/sqlite-vec)

Fixes # (issue)

Resolves #124 

## Testing

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce your results.

- Run example with `cargo run --package rig-sqlite --example vector_search_sqlite`

## Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes

## Notes

I think this might have some conflicts with #120?

Perhaps it would be easiest to merge this first then adapt it in that PR or I can adapt it after that is merged. It seems like it might remove a bunch of the code.

title: feat: hyperbolic inference API
body:
Adds the Hyperbolic inference API for text generation.

Keeping this PR small as #236 should ideally be implemented before we start adding audio and image generation.

Closes #235 if we are not supporting Marketplace API in this PR.

title: fix(neo4j): remove embeddings from top_n lookup
body:
## Description of the Fix
`Neo4jVectorIndex::top_n::<Value>()` now prevents returning the embedding vector property. When a Rig index object is created, a DB query retrieves the associated Neo4j index and the property name that stores it's embeddings vector.

### Note

Incidentally, I also improved the flow of creating indexes from an empty DB. The client now is in charge of both DB index creation and returning the Rig index object matching an existing DB index.

title: feat: fastembed integration
body:
Closes #228 

We may want to add other things like `SparseModel` in the future. However, this PR aims to serve as a starting point for the integration so this is somewhat out of scope (for the PR).

title: feat: agentic chains
body: - Add new `pipeline` module which provides a high level API to define complex workflows involving multiple LLM-powered steps

title: feat(vector-store): Add support for Neo4j
body:
This pull request introduces a new Neo4j-based vector store implementation for the Rig project. The key changes include adding the new `rig-neo4j` crate, updating the project structure, and providing documentation and examples for the new functionality.

### New Crate Addition:
* **`rig-neo4j` crate**: Added a new crate `rig-neo4j` to the project, which includes the implementation of a Neo4j-based vector store.

### Examples:
- [examples/vector_search_simple.rs](examples/vector_search_simple.rs) shows how to create an index on simple data.
- [examples/vector_search_movies_consume.rs](examples/vector_search_movies_consume.rs) shows how to query an existing index.
- [examples/vector_search_movies_create.rs](examples/vector_search_movies_create.rs) shows how to create embeddings & index on a large DB and query it in one go.

title: feat(model-providers): 16 Add Gemini Completion and Embedding Models

labels.name: model
labels.description: Relevant to new model providers or implementations

body:
### 🎯 Description & Goal
This pull request adds support for the Google Gemini LLM provider. 

- Add impl. for `EmbeddingModel` and `CompletionModel` traits for Google Gemini API
- Update to the README files, 
- New Gemini-agent/embeddings example 

### DOCS Updates:
* [`README.md`](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L37-R37): Added Google Gemini to the list of supported LLM providers. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L37-R37) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L73-R73)
* [`rig-core/README.md`](diffhunk://#diff-1ba6f89723a0990d647034467c2ed5c4356818b9df914158e9274cf400e58bb9L14-R14): Updated to include Google Gemini in the list of LLM providers. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1ba6f89723a0990d647034467c2ed5c4356818b9df914158e9274cf400e58bb9L14-R14) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-1ba6f89723a0990d647034467c2ed5c4356818b9df914158e9274cf400e58bb9L50-R50)
* [`rig-core/examples/gemini_agent.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-cc6f83ed1e7400ac0fa900837e018553a16bf1ee1e2ca6541d6a160587899176R1-R24): Added an example demonstrating how to use the Google Gemini client to create an agent and prompt it.

### Gemini Models Integration:
* [`rig-core/src/providers/gemini/client.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-9576c852df4ce35061650477d4b260d04046eab6b0980359d61bcf3465b79d3cR1-R152): Implemented the Google Gemini client with methods for creating embedding models, completion models, agents, and extractors.
* [`rig-core/src/providers/gemini/completion.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-c4e2b5b27ea89b3e1f6c4b97305607d7662a42ec521ec2be842e33c25c0c9c31R1-R387): Added support for Google Gemini completion models and defined the necessary request and response structures.
* [`rig-core/src/providers/gemini/embedding.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-7e033028f58eb540f0baeb2b25666047fac8ee5c564db58214dab4265e29fd61R1-R97): Implemented the embedding model for Google Gemini, including methods for embedding documents.

> [!note] 
> -  Anthropic & OpenAi implementation of the CompletionModel trait differ `async fn completion()`. In OpenAI we add the preamble but not with Anthropic

title: feat: Qdrant support
body:
## Description

Adds support for Qdrant - https://qdrant.tech/ to be used as vector store in Rig.

Resolves #2 


## Testing 

I've QA tested and you can run the example with

```bash
export OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-********
```

```bash
docker run -p 6333:6333 -p 6334:6334 qdrant/qdrant
```

```bash
cargo run --release --example qdrant_vector_search
```

You can view the data at http://localhost:6333/dashboard 


## Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
